str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Hagar, the servant of Sarah, concubine of Abraham. Of Hebrew origin; Hagar, the concubine of Abraham.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A mountain, hill. Probably from an obsolete oro; a mountain: -hill, mount(-ain).
Sinai, a mountain in Arabia. Of Hebrew origin; Sina, a mountain in Arabia.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Arabia, the district south of Palestine. Of Hebrew origin; Arabia, a region of Asia.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To be in the same rank with; I answer to, correspond to. From sun and stoicheo; to file together, i.e. to correspond to.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A primary particle of present time; 'now'; also as noun or adjective present or immediate.
Of Hebrew origin; Hierusalem, the capitol of Palestine.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To be a slave, be subject to, obey, be devoted. From doulos; to be a slave to.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A child, descendent, inhabitant. From the base of timoria; a child.
